chapter.title: EditBus Classes
chapter.para: This section describes the EditBus class itself, as well as the abstract EBMessage class and all classes that derive from it. See for an overview of how the EditBus works, as well as information on the EBComponent interface.

sect1.title: Class EditBus
sect1.para: This class provides a messaging system for all components that implement the EBComponent interface, including View and EBPlugin objects.

sect1.title: Class EBMessage
sect1.para: This abstract class defines a message that can be sent on the EditBus to subscribing components. It contains two attributes that can be obtained with the following methods:

listitem.para: This sets the vetoed state to true, which terminates circulation of the message to subscribers on the EditBus. To prevent a message from being vetoed, the message object must be derived from the abstract class EBMessage.NonVetoable. An object of this class will throw an InternalError if the veto() method is called on it.

sect1.para: A summary of classes derived from EBMessage can be found in the following sections.

sect1.title: Class BufferUpdate
sect1.para: This message is sent when the status of a buffer changes. It may not be vetoed by a subscriber, so that all subscribers are assured of receiving it regardless of an individual subscriber's response.

sect1.title: Class EditorExiting
sect1.para: This message signifies that the host application is about to exit. The message has no parameters and may not be vetoed.

sect1.title: Class EditorExitRequested
sect1.para: This message signifies that a request has been made for the host application to exit. The request is subject to cancellation in response to a request to write a modified buffer to storage. It may not be vetoed.

sect1.title: Class EditorStarted
sect1.para: This message signifies that the host application has started. The message is sent before any views are created. The message has no parameters and it may not be vetoed.

sect1.title: Class EditPaneUpdate
sect1.para: This message is sent when the status of a edit pane changes. It may not be vetoed.

listitem.para: Returns one of the following constants defined in the EditPaneUpdate class:
BUFFER_CHANGED - a change in the buffer displayed in the edit pane

sect1.title: Class MacrosChanged
sect1.para: This message signifies that the list of available macros have changed. The message has no parameters and may not be vetoed.

sect1.title: Class PropertiesChanged
sect1.para: This message is sent when configuration settings have been changed through any of the option panes in the options dialog. The message has no parameters and may be vetoed.

sect1.title: Class SearchSettingsChanged
sect1.para: This message is sent when settings in the Search and Replace dialog have changed. The message has no parameters and may be vetoed.

sect1.title: Class VFSUpdate
sect1.para: This message is sent when the status of a file or directory changes. This allows subscribers that display or operate upon files an opportunity to adjust their state. This message may not be vetoed.

sect1.title: Class ViewUpdate
sect1.para: This message is sent when the status of a view changes. It may not be vetoed.
